meanings.definition: To board a ship or aircraft.
meanings.sent1: The passengers will imbark the cruise ship for their vacation.
meanings.sent2: We need to imbark the plane before it takes off.
meanings.sent3: The penguins decided to imbark on a journey across the sea.
meanings.sent4: As the sun set, the birds imbarked on their nightly flight.
meanings.sent5: The children eagerly imbarked on the pirate ship adventure.

meanings.definition: To load or transport goods onto a ship or aircraft.
meanings.sent1: The workers will imbark the cargo onto the freighter.
meanings.sent2: It is important to imbark the supplies carefully to avoid damage.
meanings.sent3: The ants worked together to imbark the food onto their tiny ship.
meanings.sent4: The trucks imbarked the goods swiftly onto the waiting vessels.
meanings.sent5: The sailors carefully imbarked the precious cargo onto the ship.
